title: How to Mirror Your Mac's Screen to Your Apple TV

steps.title: Turn on your Apple TV.
steps.content: Turn on your Apple TV. If this is your first time using Apple TV, you may have to set up and configure the Apple TV before proceeding.

steps.title: Ensure your Mac and Apple TV are connected to the same Wi-Fi.
steps.content: Ensure your Mac and Apple TV are connected to the same Wi-Fi. You may need to change your Mac's connection to match that of your Apple TV. To check your current connection: Mac - Click the "Wi-Fi" icon in the upper-right corner of the screen, then look at the name of the network that has a blue and white Wi-Fi symbol next to it. Apple TV - Open Settings , select Network , and review the name of the network under the CONNECTION heading.

steps.title: Click the Control Center icon on your Mac.
steps.content: Click the Control Center icon on your Mac. It's the two sliders on the right side of the menu bar at the top of your screen. [2] X Research source If you're using macOS Catalina or earlier, click the icon of a square with a triangle in the menu bar instead. Then, choose the name of your Apple TV to connect.

steps.title: Click the Screen Mirroring icon.
steps.content: Click the Screen Mirroring icon. It's the two overlapping squares on the Control Center. Available AirPlay devices will appear.

steps.title: Click your Apple TV.
steps.content: Click your Apple TV. Depending on your settings, a 4-digit code may now appear on your Apple TV. If so, enter the code on your Mac to connect. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Choose whether to mirror or extend your screen.
steps.content: Choose whether to mirror or extend your screen. You may see a message prompting you to choose whether to share a specific window on your Mac’s screen, mirror the entire screen, or extend your Mac’s screen onto the TV. Once you’ve made your selection, click Set as Default if you want to save your preference and skip this step in the future. If you want to change your selection, click the screen mirroring icon in your Control Center again and click Change . You can also select Add Window to mirror multiple windows.

steps.title: Wait for your Mac's screen to appear on your Apple TV.
steps.content: Wait for your Mac's screen to appear on your Apple TV. Once you see your Mac's screen appear on the Apple TV, you have successfully mirrored your display. AirPlay automatically transmits the sound from your Mac to your TV. If you can't hear the sound from your Mac through your Apple TV, click the Control Center icon in your Mac’s menu bar, then click the AirPlay icon next to the Sound control (it looks like a series of concentric circles with a triangle at the bottom). Select the name of your Apple TV. Also check to make sure the volume is up and not muted on both devices. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Open a video you’d like to stream on your Mac.
steps.content: Open a video you’d like to stream on your Mac. If you want to stream just a video to your Apple TV without mirroring your Mac’s entire screen, you can do so from the video playback controls. Open a video in a streaming platform like YouTube using the Safari browser. If the video is stored locally on your computer, open it in an AirPlay-supported app such as QuickTime. [5] X Research source You won’t see the AirPlay option on videos in browsers other than Safari.

steps.title: Click the AirPlay icon in the video playback controls.
steps.content: Click the AirPlay icon in the video playback controls. It looks like a rectangle with a triangle at the bottom.

steps.title: Select your Apple TV.
steps.content: Select your Apple TV. You will see it in the list of available AirPlay devices. The video should now appear on your Apple TV. If you don’t see your Apple TV, make sure it’s connected to the same Wi-Fi network as your Mac. To stop streaming, click the AirPlay icon again in the controls on the video, then click your Mac’s name in the list of devices.

steps.title: Use the sound controls on your Mac to stream just audio.
steps.content: Use the sound controls on your Mac to stream just audio. If you want your Mac’s audio to play through the speakers on your Apple TV, you can do so through the Control Center on your Mac. Click the Control Center icon in the menu bar at the top of your Mac’s screen. Click the AirPlay icon next to the Sound control. It looks like a series of concentric circles with a triangle at the bottom. Select your Apple TV from the list of devices under the Output header.

steps.title: Make sure your Mac and Apple TV are both turned on and in range.
steps.content: Make sure your Mac and Apple TV are both turned on and in range. Both devices have to be powered up and close enough to each other to connect. [6] X Research source They should be in the same room, without a lot of other electronic devices in between them that could interfere with the signal.

steps.title: Update your Mac and your Apple TV.
steps.content: Update your Mac and your Apple TV . If either device is running outdated software, it could interfere with a proper AirPlay connection.

steps.title: Double check your Wi-Fi networks.
steps.content: Double check your Wi-Fi networks. Both your Apple TV and your Mac must be on the same Wi-Fi network for AirPlay to work. If they are both on the same network but you still can’t get AirPlay to work, make sure you have a strong Wi-Fi connection. You might need to restart your modem or router.

steps.title: Restart your Mac and your Apple TV.
steps.content: Restart your Mac and your Apple TV. Try the classic tech support trick of turning your devices off and on again. This could help iron out any glitches that are preventing AirPlay from working properly.

steps.title: Check your Home settings if you set up either device in the Home app.
steps.content: Check your Home settings if you set up either device in the Home app. You might have a restriction set in the Home app that’s preventing you from mirroring from your Mac to your Apple TV. Open Home and select ••• More > Home Settings > Speakers & TV to check for any restrictions on AirPlay or screen mirroring.

steps.title: Check for restrictions in your Apple TV settings.
steps.content: Check for restrictions in your Apple TV settings. If you’ve set up parental control restrictions on your Apple TV, they might be interfering with your ability to use AirPlay. To turn off your restrictions: [7] X Research source Press and hold the Home button on your Apple TV remote (it looks like a simplified image of a TV) to open the Control Center. Select the Restrictions icon, which looks like a padlock with a figure of a child in front of it. Enter your passcode, then set Restrictions to Off . You might also have restrictions in your general settings on who can stream to your Apple TV. To find and adjust these settings, go to Settings > AirPlay & Homekit to choose who can AirPlay to your TV (i.e., anyone, only people on the same home network, or only people using devices that are connected to the same Apple Account) and whether a password is required. [8] X Research source
